name: Southern Poverty Law Center
mission: A new SPLC report outlines the difficult trade-offs Georgia counties have been forced to accept to deliver legally compliant elections. It recommends several concrete steps to stabilize democracy in the state.
theoryOfChange: The Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) adopted its first strategic plan in 2022, outlining a vision, mission, values, and goals to advance racial justice in the Deep South and beyond. This strategic framework sets clear goals across four programmatic areas: promoting democracy and civic engagement, eliminating poverty, decarcerating and decriminalizing Black and Brown communities, and relegating white supremacy out of the mainstream. Their approach involves litigation, community mobilization, and advocacy to advance policies that protect civil rights, provide opportunity, and confront systemic injustice. The SPLC's work focuses on strengthening democracy and voting rights, dismantling white supremacy, eliminating poverty and economic inequality, and ending unjust imprisonment. They aim to achieve impact by challenging discriminatory laws, exposing hate and extremism, advocating for economic opportunity, and reforming the criminal legal and immigrant detention systems.
